intro: Glaucium corniculatum subsp. tricolor, commonly known as the three-colored gloryflower, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that features strikingly colorful flowers with three distinct hues. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to parts of southern Europe. Its flowers are characterized by their papery petals and a central stigma that stands out against the petals. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant display.
